humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions 'EXTENSIVE INFILTRATING LOBULAR CARCINOMA (GREATEST DIMENSION IN EXCESS OF 6. CM)' in the left breast. Based on the rules provided, T3 tumors are more than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report describes an extensive infiltrating lobular carcinoma with a greatest dimension exceeding 6 cm, which extends into the lactiferous duct, nipple, and random sections of the breast quadrant. Additionally, metastatic carcinoma is present in 25 out of 27 axillary lymph nodes. Based on these findings, the tumor is classified as T3 (T3: tumor size >5 cm). The report also mentions that the tumor extends to within 1.5 cm of the superior surgical margin, but this does not affect the T stage, as it only considers the size of the primary tumor.
